summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from July 29, 2020, summarizing media coverage on a wide range of topics including Attorney General William Barr's contentious House Judiciary Committee testimony, protests in Portland and other cities, counter-intelligence matters, and various criminal investigations. It includes a brief mention of federal prosecutors opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's effort to name Jeffrey Epstein's victims.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.role: Attorney General of the United States
persons.context: Testified before the House Judiciary Committee, defended federal response to protests, decisions in Flynn and Stone cases, and discussed investigations into Russia probe origins.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her legal team's effort to name underage victims she is accused of grooming for Jeffrey Epstein was opposed by federal prosecutors in a filing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the financier for whom Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly groomed underage girls.

persons.name: Alex Rossmiller
persons.context: Filed the opposition to Maxwell's effort to name victims, calling the argument 'absurd'.

persons.name: Jerrold Nadler
persons.context: Chaired the hearing with AG Barr, accused Barr of distorting the DOJ for political purposes.

persons.name: Jim Jordan
persons.context: Defended Barr, decried the Russia probe as an effort to undermine Trump, and aired a video contrasting media reports with protest violence.

persons.name: John Bash
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Western District of Texas
persons.context: Appointed by Barr to investigate 'unmasking' requests during the Obama administration, related to Michael Flynn.

persons.name: Michael Flynn
persons.context: Barr defended the DOJ's decision to drop charges against him; unmasking of Flynn is under investigation.

persons.name: Roger Stone
persons.context: Barr defended his intervention to recommend a shorter sentence for Stone, a Trump associate.

persons.name: John Durham
persons.context: Leading an investigation into the origins of the Trump-Russia probe; Barr said his report could be released before the 2020 election.

persons.name: Peter Strzok
persons.context: Announced a book about Trump and Russia investigations, to be published in September 2020.

persons.name: Christopher Steele
persons.context: His dossier on Trump-Russia connections was discussed in a declassified Senate report; his primary source was identified.

persons.name: Igor Danchenko
persons.context: Identified as the primary sub-source for the Steele dossier, worked at the Brookings Institution.

persons.name: Kayleigh McEnany
persons.context: Said Democrats' criticism of Barr is rooted in his probe of 'Russia-gate'.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Called Barr 'despicable'; was accused by Barr of endangering law enforcement by comparing federal officers to 'stormtroopers'.

persons.name: Cedric Richmond
persons.context: Accused Barr, Sessions, and Whitaker of racism for not bringing black staff to the DOJ.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.context: Criticized Democrats during Barr's hearing, said violence in Portland 'has got to stop'.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Frequently referenced in context of Barr's testimony, protests, Russia probe, and pandemic response.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Called for violent protesters to be arrested; contrasted his approach with Trump's on pandemic.

connections.description: Barr is the Attorney General serving under President Trump; Democrats accused Barr of acting as Trump's political agent, which Barr denied.
Maxwell is accused of grooming underage girls for sexual abuse by financier Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorney General Barr appointed U.S. Attorney John Bash to investigate 'unmasking' requests related to Michael Flynn.
Barr oversees U.S. Attorney John Durham's investigation into the origins of the Trump-Russia probe.
Danchenko was the primary sub-source for the anti-Trump dossier compiled by former British spy Christopher Steele.
As Committee Chairman, Nadler led the contentious hearing, accusing Barr of serving Trump's political agenda.
Ranking Member Jordan defended Barr during the hearing, blaming the Russia probe for political attacks on Barr.

events.title: Barr Testifies Before House Judiciary Committee
events.description: Attorney General William Barr gave contentious testimony before the House Judiciary Committee, defending federal actions in Portland, his interventions in the Roger Stone and Michael Flynn cases, and the Durham investigation.

events.title: Federal Prosecutors Oppose Maxwell Naming Victims
events.description: Prosecutors filed an opposition to Ghislaine Maxwell's effort to publicly name the underage victims she is accused of grooming for Jeffrey Epstein, calling the request 'absurd'.

events.title: Barr Appoints Bash to Investigate Unmasking
events.description: Attorney General Barr revealed he appointed U.S. Attorney John Bash to investigate the 'high number of unmaskings' during the Obama administration, particularly related to Michael Flynn.

events.title: Strzok Announces Book on Trump-Russia Probe
events.description: Former FBI agent Peter Strzok announced a book titled 'Compromised: Counterintelligence and the Threat of Donald J. Trump,' offering an insider view of the Russia investigation.

events.title: Portland Protests and Federal Response
events.description: Reports detailed ongoing violent protests at the federal courthouse in Portland, Oregon, and the controversial deployment of federal law enforcement agents to protect property.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors opposed Ghislaine Maxwell's effort to name Jeffrey Epstein's underage victims, calling the request 'absurd'.
Attorney General William Barr testified before the House Judiciary Committee, defending his actions in the Roger Stone and Michael Flynn cases and the federal response to Portland protests.
Barr appointed U.S. Attorney John Bash to investigate 'unmasking' requests during the Obama administration, related to former National Security Advisor Michael Flynn.
Former FBI agent Peter Strzok announced a book about the Trump-Russia investigation, set for publication in September 2020.
A declassified Senate report highlighted doubts about the Steele dossier, and its primary sub-source was identified as Igor Danchenko, a researcher at the Brookings Institution.
